channel.title: Help with Galkons Crown Adding Tut
channel.description:
[code]client.java:287: cannot find symbol symbol : variable aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219 location: class client aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[0].method361(j1, 16083, i1 - 12); ^ client.java:292: cannot find symbol symbol : variable aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219 location: class client aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[1].method361(j1, 16083, i1 - 12); ^ client.java:359: cannot find symbol symbol : variable aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219 location: class client aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[0].method361(k1, 16083, i1 - 12); ^ client.java:364: cannot find symbol symbol : variable aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219 location: class client aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[1].method361(k1, 16083, i1 - 12); ^ client.java:479: cannot find symbol symbol : variable k1 location: class client aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[0].method348(k1 , 16083, i1 - 12); ^ client.java:485: cannot find symbol symbol : variable k1 location: class client aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[1].method348(k1 , 16083, i1 - 12); ^ client.java:491: cannot find symbol symbol : variable k1 location: class client aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[2].method348(k1 , 16083, i1 - 12); ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 7 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Please help me in this matter.

item.title: Help with Galkons Crown Adding Tut
item.dc:creator: @Ebowne24 Ebowne24
item.description:
@Ebowne24 wrote:

[quote=“Diamond Pk, post:3, topic:317104”][quote author=Diamond Pk link=topic=413805.msg3047058#msg3047058 date=1259808672]
Get your image you want to show on the server beside your name, then paste it into .cache/files/spirts well if you dont have the folders be sure to add them… Well then you are pasting your crown into the right folder you have to be sure that it has to be named admin.PNG if you want to fix a admin icon… and if it is mod icon you wanna add well name it mod.PNG…

If you dont paste the images into .cache/files/spirts it wont work… well here is the code you have to paste into Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java…

Download for all crowns http://uppit.com/v/I6S1700Y

Owner Code:

[code]else if (s.startsWith(“owner”))
{
try
{
anInt1440 = 25;
anInt1441 = 16;
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./cache/Files/Spirts/owner.PNG");
anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

}
catch (Exception exception)
{
System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
}
}[/code]

Admin Code:

[code]else if (s.startsWith(“admin”))
{
try
{
anInt1440 = 25;
anInt1441 = 16;
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./cache/Files/Spirts/admin.PNG");
anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

}
catch (Exception exception)
{
System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
}
}[/code]

Mod Code:

[code]else if (s.startsWith(“mod”))
{
try
{
anInt1440 = 25;
anInt1441 = 16;
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./cache/Files/Spirts/mod.PNG");
anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

}
catch (Exception exception)
{
System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
}
}[/code]

Donator Code:

[code]else if (s.startsWith(“donator”))
{
try
{
anInt1440 = 25;
anInt1441 = 16;
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./cache/Files/Spirts/donator.PNG");
anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

}
catch (Exception exception)
{
System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
}
}[/code]

Hope You Enjoyed My Bad Tut.

[/quote][br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 02, 2009, 09:19:31 pm[/size][hr][quote author=Darque Star link=topic=413652.msg3046344#msg3046344 date=1259482621]
just so you know, crowns are client side.
[/quote][br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 02, 2009, 09:20:00 pm[/size][hr]They Are Also Server-Sided.[/quote]
Even with this… How does it know that playerRights=3 should be the owner’s picture etc. And by the way… The crowns you supplied… They are completely wrong.
1.) They have to be 13x11
2.) The owner crown looks like a vet’s crown

Read full topic
item.source: Help with Galkons Crown Adding Tut
